text.sentence: Financial Services | U.S. Large Cap Banks twenty nine February two thousand sixteen

Enforcement Actions: CFG is subject to consent orders issued in Aug two thousand fifteen by the CFPB, OCC and FDIC in connection with past deposit reconciliation practices, and CBNA is subject to a consent order issued in Nov two thousand fifteen by the OCC in connection with past billing and sales practices pertaining to identity theft and debt cancellation products.
All financial penalties associated with these legacy regulatory enforcement matters have been paid, and substantially all remediation is expected to be resolved by fourQsixteen.
RBS Exit: On Jan twenty eight, RBS received written notice from the Fed that it is not deemed to control CFG for purposes of the BHC Act.
On Nov three, RBS completed the sale of all of its remaining shares of CFG's stock.
On Nov twenty three, CFG announced that it had reached agreement with RBS to address RBS's then ownership of dollar twobn of subordinated notes.
On Dec three, CFG repurchased dollar seven hundred fiftymn of the subordinated notes held by RBS.
Loans: On Jan seven, CFG entered into an agreement to purchase a minimum of dollar one hundred twenty fivemn of student loans per quarter from oneQsixteen fourQsixteen.
On Jan eight it bought dollar three hundred sixty ninemn of loans.

Investment Spend/Incremental Charges: From two thousand ten to two thousand fifteen CFG invested dollar one.sixbn in infrastructure and tech, and plans to invest a dollar two hundred forty fivemn in two thousand sixteen and dollar one hundred sixtymn in two thousand seventeen.
CFG invested dollar two hundred nineteenmn in its infrastructure in two thousand fifteen.
As part of its transition to a fully independent public company, it expects one time incremental expenses of dollar thirty fourmn per year.
Sensitivity: For an instantaneous +one hundredbp parallel rate shift, NII is expected to rise five.eight
For a gradual one hundredbp rate rise, NII is expected to rise three.two
The notional amount of receivefixed swap hedges of floating rate loans totaled dollar eight.fivebn, up from dollar five.fivebn at threeQfifteen.

We expect its ROTCE to increase towards ten percent in two thousand sixteen through: one) increased revenues with targeted initiatives in its Consumer and Commercial segments; two) impact of rising rates; three) cost reduction efforts; and four) capital actions.
Our dollar twenty five price target implies fourteenx our two thousand sixteen EPS estimate of dollar one.eighty.
Assuming interest rates rise faster than anticipated and it achieves its revenue growth initiatives earlier than expected, we could see two thousand sixteen EPS moving towards dollar one.ninety

weaknesses cited by the FRB in relation to its capital planning processes and the weaknesses CFG are working to remedy pursuant to the OCC and FDIC consent orders, and meet its significant regulatory and supervisory challenges, it believe it needs to make substantial improvements to its processes, systems and controls.
CFG expects to continue to dedicate significant resources and managerial time and attention and to make significant investments in enhanced processes, systems and controls.
This in turn may increase its operational costs and limit its ability to implement aspects of its strategic plan or otherwise pursue certain business opportunities.

It also expects to make restitution payments to its banking subsidiaries' customers, which could be significant, arising from certain customer compliance deficiencies and may be required to pay civil money penalties in connection with certain of these deficiencies.
It has established reserves in respect of these future payments, but the amounts that it is ultimately obligated to pay could be in excess of its reserves.

Moreover, if it is unsuccessful in remedying these weaknesses and meeting the enhanced supervisory requirements and expectations that apply to it and its banking subsidiaries, it could remain subject to existing restrictions or become subject to additional restrictions on its activities, supervisory actions or public enforcement actions, including the payment of civil money penalties.

Scrutiny: As a general matter, the federal banking agencies as well as the CFPB are taking a more stringent approach to supervising and regulating financial institutions and financial products and services over which they exercise their respective supervisory authorities, including in connection with enforcement matters.

It and its two banking subsidiaries and its products and services are all subject to greater supervisory scrutiny and enhanced supervisory requirements and expectations and face significant challenges in meeting them.
CFG expects to continue to face greater supervisory scrutiny and enhanced supervisory requirements for the foreseeable future
Griggs as Executive Vice President and Chief Risk Officer effective April one, two thousand sixteen.
Griggs, who has been with the bank since two thousand fourteen, will succeed CFG's current Chief Risk Officer, Nancy Shanik, who is retiring from CFG as of May thirty one, two thousand sixteen.

Barclays | Citizens Financial Group Inc. of dollar one hundred twenty fivemn of loans per quarter.
The minimum and maximum amount of the aggregate purchase principal balance of loans under the terms of the agreement are dollar five hundredmn and dollar onebn, respectively.
The agreement will terminate immediately if at any time during its term the aggregate purchase principal balance of loans equals the maximum amount.
The agreement may be extended by written agreement of the parties for an additional four quarters.
CFG may terminate the agreement at will with payment of a termination fee equal to the product of dollar onemn times the number of calendar quarters remaining in the term.
On January eight, two thousand sixteen, CFG completed a dollar three hundred sixty ninemn purchase of student loans pursuant to the agreement described above.

In addition, CFG secured the ability through July two thousand sixteen to purchase dollar five hundredmn of its subordinated notes held by RBS, subject to regulatory approval and ratings agency considerations.

percent of CFG's outstanding common stock, to the underwriters at a price of dollar twenty three.thirty

In connection with completion of the offering, Mister Robert Gillespie, who served as RBS's board representative, resigned from the CFG Board of Directors, effective November three, two thousand fifteen.

The CFG Board of Directors appointed Christine Cumming, former First Vice President and Chief Operating Officer for the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, to the board effective as of October one, two thousand fifteen.

dollar seventeenmn of facilities costs in occupancy, dollar eightmn in outside services, and dollar onemn in salaries and employee benefits, relating to restructuring initiatives designed to enhance operating efficiencies and reduce expense growth.
In two thousand fourteen, CFG began the implementation of a restructuring initiative designed to achieve operating efficiencies and reduce expense growth.

For two thousand fourteen, CFG incurred dollar one hundred onemn of restructuring costs related to these initiatives, including dollar forty onemn of salaries and employee benefits, dollar eighteenmn of facilities costs in occupancy, dollar twenty fourmn in outside services, dollar sixmn in software expense reported in amortization of software, and dollar twelvemn in other operating expenses.
incurred cumulative one time expenditures of approximately dollar fifty twomn through the end of

Barclays | Citizens Financial Group Inc. two thousand fifteen, including capitalized costs of approximately dollar fourteenmn, as well as ongoing incremental expenses of approximately dollar thirty fourmn per year .

These ongoing costs include higher local charges associated with exiting worldwide vendor relationships and incremental expenses to support information technology, compliance, corporate governance, regulatory, financial and risk infrastructure that are necessary to enables it to operate as a fully independent public company.

For example, from two thousand ten to two thousand fifteen it invested dollar one.sixbn in infrastructure and technology, and plan to invest a total of dollar two hundred forty fivemn in two thousand sixteen and about dollar one hundred sixtymn in two thousand seventeen.
CFG invested dollar two hundred nineteenmn in its infrastructure in two thousand fifteen.

These investments, which are designed to lower its operating costs and improve its customer experience, include significant programs to enhance its resiliency, upgrade customerfacing technology and streamline operations.

Recent significant investments included the two thousand thirteen launch of its new teller system, new commercial loan platform and new auto loan platform and the two thousand thirteen upgrade of the majority of its ATM network, including equipping more than one thousand four hundred fifty ATMs with advanced deposit taking functionality as well as additional investment in its Treasury Solutions platform in two thousand fourteen.
In threeQfifteen it enhanced its data resiliency via a new back up data center and began rolling out a new mortgage platform.
It expects that these investments will increase its long term overall efficiency and add to its capacity to increase revenue.
continue to evolve as the legal and regulatory framework governing its operations continues to change.

The current operating environment also has heightened regulatory expectations around many regulations including consumer compliance, the Bank Secrecy Act, anti money laundering compliance, and increased internal audit activities.
As a result of these heightened expectations, it expects to incur additional costs for additional compliance personnel and/or professional fees associated with advisors and consultants.

The minimum and maximum amounts of the aggregate purchase principal balance of loans under the terms of the agreement are dollar five hundredmn and dollar onebn, respectively.
The agreement will terminate immediately if at any time during its term the aggregate purchase principal balance of loans equals the maximum amount.
The agreement may be extended by written agreement of the parties for an additional four quarters.
CFG may terminate the agreement at will with payment of a termination fee equal to the product of dollar onemn times the number of calendar quarters remaining in the term.

During two thousand fourteen, CFG purchased a portfolio of residential loans with an outstanding principal balance of dollar one.ninebn, a portfolio of auto loans with an outstanding principal balance of dollar one.sevenbn and a portfolio of student loans with an outstanding principal balance of dollar fifty ninemn.

Commencing on the effective date and through July thirty one, two thousand fifteen, the amended agreement requires the purchase of a minimum of dollar two hundred fiftymn of outstanding balances to a maximum of dollar six hundredmn per quarterly period.
For quarterly periods on or after August one, two thousand fifteen, the minimum and maximum purchases are dollar fiftymn and dollar two hundredmn, respectively.

Unsettled loan trades represent firm commitments to purchase loans from a third party at an agreed upon price.
Principal amounts associated with unsettled commercial loan trades are off balance sheet commitments until delivery of the loans has taken place.

Fair value adjustments associated with each unsettled loan trade are recognized on the Consolidated Balance Sheets and classified within other assets or other liabilities, depending on whether the fair value of the unsettled trade represents an unrealized gain or unrealized loss.
At fourQfifteen the principal balance of unsettled commercial loan trade purchases and sales were dollar sixty ninemn and dollar seventy fivemn, respectively.
Settled loans purchased by the trading desk are classified as loans held for sale, at fair value on the Consolidated Balance Sheets.

portfolio, or dollar four.fourbn in drawn balances were subject to a payment reset or balloon payment between January one, two thousand sixteen and December thirty one, two thousand eighteen, including dollar eightymn in balloon balances where full payment is due at the end of a ten year interest only draw period.

As of fourQfifteen for the dollar one.sixbn of its HELOC portfolio that was originally structured with a reset period in two thousand thirteen and two thousand fourteen, ninety four percent of the balances were refinanced, paid off or were current on payments, three percent were past due and three percent had been charged off.

As of fourQfifteen, for the dollar one.threebn in balances originally structured with a reset period in two thousand fifteen, ninety four percent of the balances were refinanced, paid off or were current on payments, five percent were past due and one percent had been charged off.
A total of dollar nine hundred ninety fivemn of these balances are scheduled to reset in two thousand sixteen.

Factors that affect its future expectations for charge off risk for the portion of its HELOC portfolio subject to reset periods in the future include improved loan to value ratios resulting from continued home price appreciation, stable portfolio credit score profiles and more robust loss mitigation efforts.
component of the non core portfolio is the home equity products currently or formerly serviced by other firms .
The SBO portfolio is a liquidating portfolio consisting of pools of home equity loans and lines of credit purchased between two thousand three and two thousand seven.
Although its SBO portfolio consists of loans that were initially serviced by others, CFG now services a portion of this portfolio internally.
SBO balances serviced externally totaled dollar seven hundred thirty sixmn at fourQfifteen .
The SBO portfolio has been closed to new purchases since threeQseven, with exposure down to dollar one.fourbn as of fourQfifteen .
At fourQfifteen the SBO portfolio represented four percent of the entire real estate portfolio and three percent of the overall retail loan portfolio at fourQfifteen.
portfolio, with a weighted average refreshed FICO score of seven hundred twelve and combined loan to value of ninety percent at fourQfifteen.
The proportion of the portfolio in a second lien position is ninety five percent .
The amount of the portfolio in out of footprint geographies is seventy two percent, with twenty eight percent concentrated in California, Nevada, Arizona and Florida.

SBO credit performance continued to improve in two thousand fifteen driven by continued portfolio liquidation, more effective account servicing and collection strategies, and improvements in the real estate market.

Net charge offs in two thousand fifteen of dollar two hundred eighty four million decreased dollar thirty nine million from dollar three hundred twenty three million in two thousand fourteen, driven by favorable credit conditions and higher recoveries.

The repurchase of common shares and the issuance of subordinated debt during the third quarter of two thousand fifteen were neutral to its total capital level and ratios but reduced common equity by dollar two hundred fiftymn, and the CETone and tier one risk based ratios by twenty twobps.

The repurchase of common shares and the issuance of preferred shares during twoQfifteen were generally neutral to its tier one and total capital levels and ratios but reduced common equity by dollar two hundred fiftymn and the CETone ratio by twenty threebps.

Unless CFG chooses to file an amended capital plan prior to April two thousand sixteen, the maximum levels at which it may declare dividends and repurchase shares of its common stock between March thirty one, two thousand fifteen and June thirty, two thousand sixteen are governed by its two thousand fifteen capital plan, subject to actual financial performance and ongoing compliance with internal governance and all other regulatory requirements.
For subsequent cycles, beginning in two thousand sixteen, BHCs will be required to submit their annual capital plans and stress testing results to the Federal Reserve on or before April five.

own a financial subsidiary namely that CBNA must be both well capitalized and well managed.
A financial subsidiary is permitted to engage in a broader range of activities, similar to those of a financial holding company, than those permissible for a national bank itself.
CBNA has two financial subsidiaries, Citizens Securities, Inc., a registered broker dealer, and RBS Citizens Insurance Agency, Inc., a dormant entity.

CBNA has entered into an agreement with the OCC pursuant to which CFG has developed and submitted to the OCC a remediation plan, that sets forth the specific actions it will take to bring itself back into compliance with the conditions to own a financial subsidiary.

However, until the plan has been completed to the OCC's satisfaction, CBNA will be subject to restrictions on its ability to acquire control or hold an interest in any new financial subsidiary and to commence new activities in any existing financial subsidiary without the prior consent of the OCC.
bank subsidiary in the position of having to request specific approval from the OCC before executing capital distributions to its parent, CFG.
rules implement the Committee on Banking Supervision's Basel III capital framework
Barclays | Citizens Financial Group Inc. and certain provisions of the Dodd Frank Act, including the Collins Amendment.

The U.S. Basel III final rules substantially revised the risked based capital and leverage requirements applicable to bank holding companies and their insured depository institution subsidiaries, including CBNA and CBPA.
The U.S. Basel III final rules became effective for CFG and its depository institution subsidiaries, including CBNA and CBPA, on January one, two thousand fifteen .

In order to comply with the new capital requirements, it established internal capital ratio targets that meet or exceed U.S. regulatory expectations under fully phased in Basel III rules, and increased its capital requirements in anticipation of the transition that is underway.
to cover expected net cash outflows over a thirty day liquidity stress period.
In September two thousand fourteen, the U.S. federal banking regulators published the final rule to implement the LCR.

This rule also introduced a modified version of the LCR in the United States, which generally applies to BHCs not active internationally, with total assets of greater than dollar fiftybn but less than dollar two hundred fiftybn.
Under this definition, it is designated as a modified LCR company.

As compared to the Basel Committee's version of the LCR, the version of the LCR issued by the U.S. federal banking regulators includes a narrower definition of high quality liquid assets, different prescribed cash inflow and outflow assumptions for certain types of instruments and transactions and a shorter phase in schedule that began on January one, two thousand fifteen and ends on January one, two thousand seventeen.

Notably, as a modified LCR company, it was required to be ninety percent compliant beginning in January two thousand sixteen, and one hundred percent compliant beginning in January two thousand seventeen.

Achieving sustainable LCR compliance may require changes in the size and/or composition of its investment portfolio, the configuration of its discretionary wholesale funding portfolio, and its average cash position.
It is compliant with the LCR as of fourQfifteen, and it is fully compliant with the LCR as of the required implementation date of January two thousand sixteen.

The Basel Committee contemplates that the NSFR, including any revisions, will be implemented as a minimum standard by January one, two thousand eighteen; however, the U.S. federal banking regulators have not yet published a proposed rule to implement the NSFR in the United States
It expects to be fully compliant with the final rules on or prior to the applicable effective date.

than dollar fiftybn in assets to annually submit a resolution plan that explains CFG's strategy, in the event of material financial distress or failure, for rapid, orderly and systemically safe resolution.

If the FRB and the FDIC jointly determine that the resolution plan of a bank holding company is not credible, and CFG fails to cure the deficiencies in a timely manner, then the FRB and the FDIC may jointly impose on CFG, or on any of its subsidiaries, more stringent capital, leverage or liquidity requirements or restrictions on growth, activities or operations, or require the divestment of certain assets or operations.

Because RBS no longer controls it for bank regulatory purposes, it will separately file its own bank holding company resolution plan with the FRB and FDIC in accordance with their regulations, including required timelines.

In addition, an insured depository institution with more than dollar fiftybn in assets, including CBNA, must submit to the FDIC a resolution plan that explains how that institution could be resolved in a manner that is orderly and that ensures that depositors will receive access to insured
Barclays | Citizens Financial Group Inc. funds within certain required timeframes.
On December twenty three, two thousand fifteen, it submitted its resolution plan for CBNA to the FDIC.
lessees to recognize a right of use asset and corresponding lease liability for all leases with a lease term of greater than one year.
The ASU is effective for CFG beginning on January one, two thousand nineteen.
CFG is currently assessing the impact of this guidance on CFG's Consolidated Financial Statements.
The ASU requires equity investments to be measured at fair value with changes in the fair value recognized through net income.

The ASU also requires separate presentation of financial assets and financial liabilities by measurement category and form of financial assets on the balance sheet or the notes to the financial statements.

In addition, the ASU makes several other targeted amendments to the existing accounting and disclosure requirements for financial instruments, including revised guidance related to valuation allowance assessments when recognizing deferred tax assets on unrealized losses on available for sale debt securities.
The ASU is effective for CFG beginning on January one, two thousand eighteen.
CFG is currently assessing the impact of this guidance on CFG's Consolidated Financial Statements.
Presentation and Subsequent Measurement of Debt Issuance Costs Associated with Line Of Credit Arrangements.

The ASU incorporates guidance from the SEC on deferral of debt issuance costs associated with line of credit arrangements, consistent with ASU two thousand fifteen three, regardless of whether there are any outstanding borrowings on the line ofcredit arrangement.
This new guidance will not have a material impact on CFG's Consolidated Financial Statements.
Customers : Deferral of the Effective Date which defers the effective date of the new revenue standard by one year.
As a result of this deferral, the new revenue standard is effective for CFG beginning on January one, two thousand eighteen.
CFG is currently assessing the impact of this guidance on the Consolidated Financial Statements.

This standard requires debt issuance costs to be presented in the consolidated balance sheet as a direct deduction from the carrying value of the associated debt liability, consistent with the presentation of a debt discount.
The ASU, which allows for early adoption, is effective for CFG beginning on January one, two thousand sixteen.
Adoption of this guidance is not expected to have a material impact on CFG's Consolidated Financial Statements.

This new standard simplifies consolidation accounting by reducing the number of consolidation models.
The ASU will be effective for CFG beginning on January one, two thousand sixteen.
Adoption of this guidance will not have a material impact on CFG's Consolidated Financial Statements.

and Unusual Ite Miss This ASU eliminates from GAAP the concept of extraordinary ite Miss Accounting Standards Codification Subtopic two hundred twenty five twenty required that an entity separately classify, present, and disclose extraordinary events and transactions that were unusual in nature and infrequent in occurrence.
This ASU, which allows for early adoption, is effective for CFG beginning on January one, two thousand sixteen.
The adoption of this guidance is not expected to have a material impact on CFG's Consolidated Financial Statements.

investigations, reviews, and regulatory matters arising out of its normal business operations which, in some instances, relate to concerns about unfair and/or deceptive practices and mis selling of certain products.

In addition, CFG engages in discussions with relevant governmental and regulatory authorities on a regular and ongoing basis regarding various issues, and any issues discussed or identified may result in investigatory or other action being taken.

Litigation and regulatory matters may result in settlements, damages, fines, penalties, public or private censure, increased costs, required remediation, restrictions on business activities, or other impacts on CFG.
subject to extensive laws and regulations concerning unfair or deceptive acts or practices in connection with customer products.

Certain of the banking subsidiaries' past practices have not met applicable standards, and they have implemented and are continuing to implement changes to improve and bring their practices in accordance with regulatory guidance.
CFG and its banking subsidiaries have actively pursued resolution of the legacy regulatory enforcement matters set forth below.
the OCC in connection with its findings of deceptive marketing and implementation of some of its checking account and funds transfer products and services.
Among other things, the consent order requires it to remedy deficiencies and develop stronger compliance controls, policies and procedures.

CFG and its banking subsidiaries are also currently subject to consent orders issued in August two thousand fifteen by the CFPB, the OCC and the FDIC in connection with past deposit reconciliation practices, and CBNA is subject to a consent order issued in November two thousand fifteen by the OCC in connection with past billing and sales practices pertaining to identity theft and debt cancellation products, under which the applicable regulators will have to provide non objections to, among other things, restitution plans for affected customers.
enforcement matters have been paid, and substantially all remediation related to such legacy matters is expected to be resolved by the end of two thousand sixteen.
weaknesses cited by the FRB in relation to its capital planning processes and the

Barclays | Citizens Financial Group Inc. weaknesses CFG are working to remedy pursuant to the OCC and FDIC consent orders, and meet its significant regulatory and supervisory challenges, it believe it needs to make substantial improvements to its processes, systems and controls.
CFG expects to continue to dedicate significant resources and managerial time and attention and to make significant investments in enhanced processes, systems and controls.
This in turn may increase its operational costs and limit its ability to implement aspects of its strategic plan or otherwise pursue certain business opportunities.

It also expects to make restitution payments to its banking subsidiaries' customers, which could be significant, arising from certain customer compliance deficiencies and may be required to pay civil money penalties in connection with certain of these deficiencies.
It has established reserves in respect of these future payments, but the amounts that it is ultimately obligated to pay could be in excess of its reserves.

Moreover, if it is unsuccessful in remedying these weaknesses and meeting the enhanced supervisory requirements and expectations that apply to it and its banking subsidiaries, it could remain subject to existing restrictions or become subject to additional restrictions on its activities, supervisory actions or public enforcement actions, including the payment of civil money penalties.

Scrutiny: As a general matter, the federal banking agencies as well as the CFPB are taking a more stringent approach to supervising and regulating financial institutions and financial products and services over which they exercise their respective supervisory authorities, including in connection with enforcement matters.

It and its two banking subsidiaries and its products and services are all subject to greater supervisory scrutiny and enhanced supervisory requirements and expectations and face significant challenges in meeting them.
CFG expects to continue to face greater supervisory scrutiny and enhanced supervisory requirements for the foreseeable future

Guide to the Barclays Fundamental Equity Research Rating System: Our coverage analysts use a relative rating system in which they rate stocks as Overweight, Equal Weight or Underweight relative to other companies covered by the analyst or a team of analysts that are deemed to be in the same industry .
In addition to the stock rating, we provide industry views which rate the outlook for the industry coverage universe as Positive, Neutral or Negative .
A rating system using terms such as buy, hold and sell is not the equivalent of our rating system.
Investors should carefully read the entire research report including the definitions of all ratings and not infer its contents from ratings alone.
Stock Rating Overweight The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.
Equal Weight The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelvemonth investment horizon.
Underweight The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.

Rating Suspended The rating and target price have been suspended temporarily due to market events that made coverage impracticable or to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies in certain circumstances including where the Investment Bank of Barclays Bank PLC is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving the company.
Neutral industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.

Valuation Methodology: Our price target is dollar twenty five and equates to fourteenx our two thousand sixteen EPS estimate of dollar one.eighty.

Risks which May Impede the Achievement of the Barclays Research Valuation and Price Target: The company's ability to achieve a ten percent ROTCE in the medium term is dependent on a rising interest rate environment.
If rates do not rise as anticipated over that time frame, achieving this target would be challenging.
It is also investing in a number of strategic initiatives that will take time before reaching revenue goals.
